intro: Aegiphila longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically tubular and clustered in whorls, producing a fragrant scent that attracts pollinators. Aegiphila longifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
